title: R43466
content: Children in foster care have higher mental health care needs and are more likely to receive psychotropic medications. These medications are prescribed to treat various mental health conditions, but there is limited evidence on their safety and efficacy in children. Congress is closely monitoring the use of psychotropic medications in foster children, as federal law requires states to have a plan for overseeing their prescription drug use. It also covers congressional oversight and efforts by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services to ensure appropriate medication use.
